title: Example: Service worker Invariant violated (initialize): latest hash null
body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[X] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior Firstly I'm unable to get the service worker to register using ``` ServiceWorkerModule.register('ngsw-worker.js', { enabled: environment.production }) ``` I have to use the following in my main.ts ``` platformBrowserDynamic() .bootstrapModule(AppModule) .then(() => { if ('serviceWorker' in navigator && environment.production) { navigator.serviceWorker.register('/ngsw-worker.js'); } }) ``` and when I test locally the service worker registers fine. But after I deploy to my server the service worker fails to register with the following error > ngsw-worker.js:2178 Uncaught (in promise) Error: Invariant violated (initialize): latest hash null has no known manifest at Driver. (ngsw-worker.js:2178) at Generator.next () at fulfilled (ngsw-worker.js:1755) maybe this is why the recommended way to register the service worker fails, although unsure on that as I don't get any errors. ## Expected behavior The service worker was installed using angular cli and has been setup without any changes and is installed as per the documentation, however this doesn't work. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions As the issue can't be replicated locally there's little value in providing code. Need to understand why the same production build works locally but doesn't when deployed. ## Environment 

Angular CLI: 6.1.4
Node: 8.11.3
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 6.1.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router
... service-worker

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.7.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.7.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.7.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.7.4
@angular-devkit/core               0.7.4
@angular-devkit/schematics         0.7.4
@angular/cdk                       6.4.6
@angular/cli                       6.1.4
@angular/material                  6.4.6
@angular/material-moment-adapter   6.4.6
@angular/pwa                       0.7.4
@ngtools/webpack                   6.1.4
@schematics/angular                0.7.4
@schematics/update                 0.7.4
rxjs                               6.2.2
typescript                         2.9.2
webpack                            4.9.2

Others:

title: fix(router): make relativeLinkResolution corrected by default
body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [X] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

```
[X] Bugfix
```

## What is the current behavior?
To apply the fix of https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/22394 in Angular 6.x, you have to set `relativeLinkResolution` to  `corrected`.


## What is the new behavior?
This PR makes this the default for Angular 7.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?
```
[X] Yes
[ ] No
```
Routing behaviour will be affected for empty path routes.

## Other information
See https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/22394/files.

Credits to @adriensamson.

title: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError where [ngClass] is used together with form
body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[X] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior We have a form where validation is not run until the form is submitted. This means that we use [required]="form.submitted" on multiple inputs. We also use [ngClass] to add a class if the input is invalid. When the form is submitted the following error is thrown: ERROR Error: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'foo: false'. Current value: 'foo: true'. ## Expected behavior The error should not be thrown and ngClass should add/remove the class based on the latest form state. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions 1. Create a form where [required] on an input is bound to form.submitted 2. Use an [ngClass] which checks input.invalid This is a small example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-gitter-22tjgr Press "SUBMIT" ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? We do not want to show any errors before the user submits the form. ## Environment 

Angular version: 6.1.1

- [X] Chrome (desktop) version 68.0.3440.106

title: fix(compiler): update compiler to generate new slot allocations
body:
Waiting on rebase from https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/25587, see second commit.

This PR updates the compiler with the new slot allocation order. Specifically, it removes the `reserveSlots` instructions and ensures that binding and interpolation counts are accounted for when calculating slot offsets.

Still TODO:
- Add `hostVars` count

title: build(bazel): remove workaround no longer needed for module names for ngfactory & ngsummary files
body:
Resolves https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/11835.

The underlying issue in the compiler that required this workaround to give ngfactory & ngsummary files proper AMD names has been resolved so it is no longer needed.

Fixes #22231

title: Unexpected behavior for providedIn services in TestBed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
`providedIn` has brought a lot of goodies into the Angular world, especially for lazy loaded modules configurations. BUT... On the testing side, it's current behavior is confusing and unwanted for isolation. ## I'm submitting a... 

[x] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[ ] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[x] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior `providedIn` providers are being loaded automatically by `TestBed` 's Testing Module. ## Expected behavior I test all of my test in isolation. I would like the providers to not be configured automatically (only during testing) so I could see an error if I forgot to stub / mock any provider. If we're not going to change the behavior, at least let's add a FLAG that gives people the opportunity to configure `TestBed` to fail when not manual configuring `providedIn` services. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions look at the following project: It's not clear from the `hello.component.spec.ts` that an ajax request somewhere down the injection tree is being called open the console and see the message from the `product.service.ts` https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-testing-providedin-example ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? Imagine the following (very realistic) scenario: 1. You write an test for your main component (isolating all of it's immediate dependencies) 2. This component has child components 3. Sometime in the future, another developer adds a dependency to one of the child components which has some side effect (ajax request or an error, or a change to the router, etc) 4. It will take you quite a while ( in a large scale app) to track down the specific reason The bad part about this is that it's very sneaky and not obvious because the failure usually will come later and not as soon as possbie. So I suggest, to ignore `providedIn` services in TestBed on purpose (or at least add a FLAG that allows you to achieve this behavior for the sake of our test debugging time) ## Environment 

Angular version: 6.1.2

milestone.title: needsTriage

[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)

## Current behavior I have a service which executes an http get request in its constructor. When the service is injected into a constructor of a Component it's working, but when it's injected into the constructor of a HttpInterceptor it's undefined. ## Expected behavior That the instance of the service is not undefined when it's injected into the HttpInterceptor constructor. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions Open this example which highlights the problem in the console: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cbhw93 ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? I'm assuming this is a bug, since I haven't found any documentation stating that preforming an http request in the constructor of a Service isn't supported. ## Environment

title: Router cant navigate when error within resolvers and guards occurs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[X] Bug report 
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior If observable throws error within guards or resolvers, then router.navigate in custom error handler fails. Router.navigate was called in ngZone. Navigation will only complete, if change detection is called manually. ## Expected behavior Router is able to navigate without manual change detection. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions DEMO: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-gitter-j2ft7u 1. Run demo 2. Click on 'Go to feature' 3. Now you can see an error in console, but router doenst navigate to /error page 4. Click on 'Run change detection' 5. Now the /error page is loaded ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? Navigating in global error handler should work ;) ## Environment 

Angular version: 6.1.3, but also in Version 5.x

title: Animation trigger with params won't work without a value

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
So i have the following template: ```
...
``` And in the component: ``` animations: [ trigger('image', [ transition(':enter', [ style({ transform: 'translateX({{enter}})' }), animate('0.7s ease-in-out', style({ transform: 'translateX(0)' })) ], { params: { enter: '0%' } }), transition(':leave', [ style({ transform: 'translateX(0)' }), animate('0.7s ease-in-out', style({ transform: 'translateX({{leave}})' })) ], { params: { leave: '-100%' } }) ]) ] ``` ``` chapterAnimation = { value: 'foo', params: { enter: '100%', leave: '-100%' } }; ``` If i leave out the ```value: 'foo'``` line, the animation WILL NOT use the provided params and just use the default params. That is the bug (took me quite a while to figure out). Angular 6.0.7

title: fix(ivy): create LViewData from blueprint
body:
This PR creates a full-length `LViewData` array from a blueprint saved on the `TView`. This ensures that we don't create sparse arrays if pure function bindings are set before regular bindings (i.e. all the slots are pre-filled on creation).  It should also be faster to slice a blueprint than to create an array from scratch.

Still TODO:
- Update compiler with  new slot allocation scheme

## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Navigating to an auxiallry route on a lazy loaded empty base route throws the following error:

> Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Cannot read property 'routes' of undefined

https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/12842

AuthorsInterface Number: #12842 

```
export const routes: Routes = [
  {
    path: 'login',
    component: LoginModalComponent,
    outlet: 'modal'
  },
  {
    path: '',
    children: [
        {
            path: '',
            loadChildren: './Main/main.module#MainModule',
        },
    ]
  }
]
```

## What is the new behavior?

Navigating to an auxiallry route on a lazy loaded empty base route does not throw any error and navigates successfully


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?
```
[ ] Yes
[x ] No
```

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

title: build(bazel): fix bazel types reference directive resolves
body:
Depends on https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/25490 && https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_typescript/pull/259.

Build will fail with tsickle diagnostics until https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/25490 lands and this is rebased.

Will need to updated to tagged rules_typescript release after https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_typescript/pull/259 lands.

title: SelectControlValueAccessor overwriting NativeElement's value if using custom control value accessor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior I'm using custom control value accessor UseValueAsNumber with ReactiveForms on SELECT element but default SelectControlValueAccessor from Angular is overwriting values set by UseValueAsNumber. The problem seems to be following: 1. UseValueAsNumber sets NativeElement value through: `this.renderer.setProperty( this.elementRef.nativeElement, 'value', this.value ); ` 2. After the value is set correctly, the `NgSelectOption.setValue()` method is fired which internally calls `if (this._select) this._select.writeValue(this._select.value);`. However `this._select.value` is `undefined` (as there is only 1 ControlValueAccessor allowed per FormControl) but `this._select` (which is in fact SelectControlValueAccessor instance) overwrites NativeElement's value to `undefined` and in HTML the correct value is never selected. ## Expected behavior Do not overwrite NativeElement's value property in order to display correct value in HTML. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-gitter-marugk ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? ## Environment 

Angular version: 6.1.3


Browser:
- [x ] Chrome (desktop) version 68.0.3440.106

title: Different behavior in IE when passing undefined as attribute value

milestone.title: needsTriage

body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior In IE when `undefined` is passed as attribute, the attribute stays unchanged ## Expected behavior The attribute should be removed from element ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-izw8fv In Chrome, when You click "set value" value attribute will be added to input and when You click "reset value" the attribute will be removed. In IE, when You click "reset value" nothing changes ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? Consistent behavior across browsers ## Environment

title: Error could not resolve module in /x/. Failed to compile. The real problem is with maximum length of path

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[ ] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x ] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior When I had updated Angular to latest version (6.1.4) and then try to run it by "npm start" I was receiving > ERROR in Could not resolve module /D/Work/lumyslinski/app_projects/project_c > Failed to compile The path was shortened without telling what module is missing. ## Expected behavior It should tell me what module is missing. ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions Create new angular app in the path that has got more than 106 characters. ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? ## Environment 

Angular version: 6.1.4


Browser:
- [x ] Chrome (desktop) version 68.0.3440.106
- [ ] Chrome (Android) version XX
- [ ] Chrome (iOS) version XX
- [ ] Firefox version XX
- [ ] Safari (desktop) version XX
- [ ] Safari (iOS) version XX
- [ ] IE version XX
- [ ] Edge version XX
 
For Tooling issues:
- Node version: 6.3.0
- Platform:  Windows 10 / Ubuntu 18.04
Solution: If You put the ClientApp to the root path like D:\ClientApp everything is working ok. See attached print screen. ![screen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/764448/44311119-ec2ad800-a3e1-11e8-9447-f72e2ba1cecb.jpg) I guess that some module do not like quite long paths...

title: BrowserAnimationsModule 6.X fail on Android 4.4 and Android 5.0

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
## I'm submitting a... 

[x] Regression (a behavior that used to work and stopped working in a new release)
[x] Bug report  
[ ] Performance issue
[ ] Feature request
[ ] Documentation issue or request
[ ] Support request => Please do not submit support request here, instead see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#question
[ ] Other... Please describe:
## Current behavior JS errors occurs on Android 4.4 and 5.0. * TypeError: Cannot read property 'trim' of undefined at applyKeyframeAnimation * Cannot read property 'split' of undefined at removeKeyframeAnimation ## Expected behavior It should works. (Like with Angular 5.X) ## Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions Just try to animate something. * https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-animation-load-data-rxtbca => Click on "Go to two" * https://material.angular.io/components/dialog/overview => Pick One" + Try to close the popup. ## What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior? It should works on this device type. ## Environment

Others:
There is no crash when you use NoopAnimationsModule instead of BrowserAnimationsModule ... but there is no animation ;-)

title: [WIP]docs: rewrite binding-syntax section in template-syntax.md
body:

[ ] Bugfix
[ ] Feature
[ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
[ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
[ ] Build related changes
[ ] CI related changes
[x] Documentation content changes
[ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
[ ] Other... Please describe:
```

## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Current section uses hero examples. 

AuthorsInterface Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
Rewrite of Binding Section updates prose and introduces an example specific to Binding Syntax that demos the two examples that are currently explained in that section. It also moves away from heroes.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?
```
[ ] Yes
[x] No
```

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

This is part 2 of the Template Syntax rewrite. The intention is that each part be rewritten with relevant, separate examples. When the entire Template Syntax document is complete, these will be broken out into their own standalone docs.
